techmeme.title: Memo: the US DOD seeks to secure right-to-repair provisions in Army contracts to access tools, software, and technical data without IP constraints (Reuters)
Apple updates its App Store Guidelines to comply with a US judge's April 30 injunction, including allowing app developers to link to external payments in the US (Chance Miller/9to5Mac)
Temu appears to have removed all products in the US version of its online store that ship directly from China to US consumers, confusing suppliers and customers (Zeyi Yang/Wired)
Atlassian reports Q3 revenue up 14% YoY to $1.36B, vs. $1.29B est., and a net loss of $70.8M, vs. a $12.8M net profit a year ago; TEAM drops 16%+ after hours (Duncan Riley/SiliconANGLE)
MoviePass launches Mogul, a daily fantasy sports-inspired, blockchain-based platform for movie buffs, and says over 400K people have signed up for early access (Lauren Forristal/TechCrunch)
